summary:
The code defines a function `resolve` that takes a list of tuples containing name and email as input. It resolves the GitHub login for each person based on the provided name and email. The function uses caching and a single resolution method to find the login. It returns a set of resolved logins and a set of unknowns (people who couldn't be resolved). The code also includes imports and other modules related to GitHub and packaging.
The user wants a summary of the functionality of the code, focusing on business logic, inputs, outputs, in Chinese (or Chinese/English). Must start directly with the summary content, no "This code does..." etc. So we need to produce a concise summary in Chinese, maybe with some English terms.

The code snippet is incomplete; we have only part of a class method `resolve`. It uses `self.__resolve_cache`, `self.__resolve_single`, `self.__register`. It iterates over `people` list of (name,email). It builds sets `logins` and `unknowns`. It returns them.

We need to mention that inputs: iterable of (name,email). Output: tuple of two sets: resolved GitHub logins and unknown entries.

Business logic: resolve GitHub usernames using cache and single resolution, register mapping.

Also mention imports: argparse, atexit, collections, json, re, sys, pathlib.Path, github, pygit2, packaging.version. But the core function is about resolving GitHub usernames.
